title: Non-umpire incident landing page updates | Incidents
custom_steps:
As a non-umpire incident viewer, I want to organize the incident landing page in a more consumable way

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/O09y57l|https://zpl.io/O09y57l|smart-link] 

*AC*

# If I am a non-umpire user with major or minor league incident viewer permissions, the following updates are made to the incident landing page
## The status filter defaults to Submitted and Published
## The game information is broken out
### Column for Game
### Column for Date/Time

title: Umpire department comments not visible on submitted incident form | Incidents
custom_steps:
*Actual Result*

After an incident is submitted, the Umpire Department Comments section of the incident report is not available. Clicking on Edit Umpire Fields opens up all fields on the report and then exposes the Umpire Department Comments

*Expected Result*

Once an incident is submitted and is being reviewed by an Incident Publisher, the Umpire Department Comments section of the form is immediately available.

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Log in to STG with an account that has Incident Publisher permissions
## umpire_blue1@mlb.com
# Navigate to Incidents
# Open an incident that is in a submitted state
# Notice the Umpire Department Comments section is not visible
# Click Edit Umpire Fields
# Notice Umpire Department Comments is now visible

title: Reopening a published incident | Incidents
custom_steps:
As a user with incident publisher permissions, I need a way to reopen a published incident so that changes can be made

*AC*

# Given an incident has been published and I have the Major or Minor League Incident Publisher permission
## If I have opened the published incident, there is a â€œReopenâ€� button
## Clicking Reopen opens a confirmation modal
### â€œAre you sure you want to reopen this incident?â€�
### On Reopen
#### The form status is changed to â€œReopenedâ€�
## Viewing the form functions as if it were in a submitted state
### The form is available on the incidents landing page table as â€œReopenedâ€�
### Clicking on the form opens the form with all of the same functionality as a Submitted form
# Users who would be able to see the incident in a Submitted state can see it in a Reopened state, and users who cannot see the incident in a submitted state cannot see it in a reopened state

title: Incidents | If other is selected as a reason the user can submit without the subsequent text box being populated
custom_steps:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create an incident
# In the people involved table select reason â€œOtherâ€� and leave the additional text box blank
# Fill in the rest of the required fields

*Expected:*

The Submit button is disabled

*Actual:*

The submit button is active

!Screen Shot 2023-03-06 at 4.08.09 PM.png|width=1516,height=980!

This functionality should also include minor league incidents 

# If â€œOther Reason Not Listedâ€� is chosen from these options, there is a text field that is visible and required

title: Populating an incident PDF | Incidents
custom_steps:
PDF mocks: [https://www.sketch.com/s/0489bf62-8940-4c44-a361-d659ef3d541e|https://www.sketch.com/s/0489bf62-8940-4c44-a361-d659ef3d541e|smart-link] 

*Acceptance criteria*

# The PDF downloaded as part of [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BLUE-512|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BLUE-512|smart-link] should generally conform to the mock PDF.
## Including all the information and readability take precedence over exact formatting
## The Incident PDF contents requirements can be found here: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/l/cp/1zLkb0zb|https://baseball.atlassian.net/l/cp/1zLkb0zb|smart-link] 
# For this story, all of the incident information in the PDF should reflect the current incident state.

custom_steps:

*Acceptance criteria*

# The PDF downloaded as part of [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BLUE-512|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BLUE-512|smart-link] should generally conform to the mock PDF.
## Readability takes precedence over exact formatting
# For this story it is not necessary for the PDF contents to reflect the actual contents of the incident.

title: Submit button disabled when 2nd person added | Incidents
custom_steps:
*Actual Result*

When trying to create an incident with a minor league umpire, I cannot submit once a 2nd person is added to the report on a game situation

*Expected Result*

Once required fields are filled out across the form, the submit button is enabled and the form can be submitted

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Log in with a minor league umpire account
## Note I tested this in UAT with [umpire_blue5@mlb.com|mailto:umpire_blue5@mlb.com]
# Create an incident
# Fill out the incident form but donâ€™t include a 2nd person involved
# Once all required fields are filled in, notice the Submit button is available
# Now enter a 2nd person involved and fill out all the required fields
# Notice the Submit button is still disabled

title: Umpire - Viewing a returned incident form does not display Submitted
custom_steps:
While testing [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BLUE-487|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BLUE-487|smart-link] 

* Expected: Matt S - We should retain the original submitted time here.
* Actual: Submitted does not display in the table.

Given an incident form has been returned and I am the reporting umpire or listed on the crew, there is an entry in the incident landing page table that matches the table record below

*Table Entry*

||*Status*||*Game*||*Type*||*People Involved*||*Submitting Umpire*||*Submitted*||
|Returned|[Away @ Home] * [mm/dd/yy] * [game time (local)]|[Aggregate types from the game situation]|[Aggregate people involved from the game situation]|[Last name, first name]|{color:#ff5630}[Submission time]{color}|

title: Emailing incidents on publish | Incidents
custom_steps:
As a user with incident publisher permissions, I want an email to be sent to a distribution list when an incident is published so that baseball ops is notified

*AC*

# If I have published a minor league incident, an email is sent to [+milb-incidents@MLB.com+|mailto:milb-incidents@MLB.com]
# The email includes the following
## Subject = Incident report filed by [Umpire]
### Umpire = Last, Use
## Body 
### â€œAn incident report has been filed for the [home franchise name] home game on [game date] by [umpire] [email].â€�
### â€œPlease log in to BLUE to view this report by clicking here [link to BLUE incident]
## Attachment of incident PDF 

*Implementation Notes*

* This story will require that we generate the PDF automatically on publish - we may want to do this asynchronously so that if PDF generation is slow (or if the email fails, or any other reason) it doesn't impact the actual publish.
* Also an implementation note - for non-prod environments we will need to designate a different distribution list and/or disable emails.

title: Incidents: prevent deletion of any incident that is not a draft
custom_steps: Also, create a non-PROD, scoped endpoint for deleting published incidents to be used by automated tests

title: Incident form text and WYSIWYG fields not behaving as expected
custom_steps:
The text and WYSIWYG fields on the incident form are not behaving as expected right now due to the recent autosave changes. We need to take a look at this behavior to understand what updates need to be made.

Issues:

* When typing in one of the free text fields, text is either very slow to type or does not capture all the keystrokes as autosave is happening
* The cursor moves back to the beginning of the free text field after a few keystrokes, which prevents users from writing comprehensive sentences

* If you add the Creator permission to the user, there is no 403. So itâ€™s only a user with Viewer and Publisher, without Creator, which is what the ticket calls for in the AC.

title: 2022 umpire data for testing incidents in DEV / STG
custom_steps:
Umpires can only create 2022 incidents in BLUE at this time.

* 2 or 3 umpires setup on the same crew in the 2022 season
* The above 2 or 3 umpire credentials

This is required to verify that a crew can view incidents created by other crew members.

This is required to verify editing/deleting cannot be executed on an umpire incident by other crew members.

* Also the same for Minor League

Data Fix to add the existing 2 umpires we have credentials for:

|[umpire_blue11@mlb.com|mailto:umpire_blue11@mlb.com]|Umpire (Major)|configured as MLB umpire John Tumpane|
|[umpire_blue12@mlb.com|mailto:umpire_blue12@mlb.com]|Umpire (Major)|configured as MLB umpire Pat Hoberg|

custom_steps:

I noticed the 2 Major League umpires in STG, have their incidents displayed by non-umpire users in the Major and Minor 2022 incident tables. These are Major League umpires, and should not display in the Minor League Incident table.

!Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 1.08.04 PM.png|width=1722,height=946!

title: Incident Report logs user out on initial view
custom_steps:
When first opening an incident report, the page attempts to save multiple times before logging the user out.  The logout may not occur for all users, but the save behavior and permissions should be checked to ensure that this does not occur.

AC1:  Users who can view the report are not logged out when viewing the form.

We should also investigate whether the save behavior is operating as intended - should the form be saving when it opens initially?

title: Coaches names on the incident form are displayed incorrectly
non-umpire filtering minor league incidents by level/league
custom_steps:
As a user with minor league incident viewer permissions, I need a way to filter the incidents by level/league so that I can narrow my incidents

*Mockup* [https://zpl.io/L4Rx5J7|https://zpl.io/L4Rx5J7|smart-link] 

*AC*

# If I am a non-umpire user Minor League Incident Viewer permissions, there is a single filter on the Minor League Incidents page for level/league
# The filter is blank by default
# The filter is grouped by classification and each classification has a header
# All leagues are available as under each header
# Each classification has an option to select all leagues within that classification
## Ex. within AAA, in addition to Pacific Coast League and International League, there is an option for All AAA Leagues
# Only one option can be selected and choosing one applies that filter to the Incidents that are shown on the incident landing page table 
# The filter has typeahead enabled

title: Create an Incident | This Year | Any game in the list directs to NYM @ PIT Thu, Aug 18
custom_steps:
[~accountid:5d10008ae69c1c0c88af127e] while starting to test in STG [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BLUE-354|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BLUE-354|smart-link] along with other stories that require Incident Report form testing, the Incident Report form is a constant:

!Screen Shot 2023-01-23 at 1.42.20 PM.png|width=1769,height=797!

* Authenticate as [umpire_blue12@mlb.com|mailto:umpire_blue12@mlb.com]
* Navigate to Incidents
* Create an Incident
* Select This Year in the dropdown
* Select any date: Ex. Sun, Oct 1 TEX @ SEA or any date

Expected: Form for TEX @ SEA with Game Situation | People Involved

Actual: Screenshot above. Mets @ PIT for any date selected.

# Incidents that are in a published state are available on the incident landing page table

title: Generating a PDF on publish | Incidents
custom_steps:
As a user with incident publisher permissions, I want a PDF report to be generated when I publish so that I have an official report to distribute to the appropriate parties

*AC*

# If I have the Major or Minor League Incident Viewer permission, there is a download button next to â€œPublishedâ€� on the incident table for published incidents
## Clicking the button downloads a PDF. 
# The contents and formatting of the PDF will be covered by subsequent stories.

title: Umpire - Adding reason to the incident form | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I need to add a reason to the incident form so I can designate what the incident reason is

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|smart-link]

*AC*

# If I am the reporting umpire for a game situation on a Major League incident form, there is a Reason dropdown that contains the reasons in the order presented in the table below
## The Reason field is required
## If â€œOtherâ€� is selected, there is a text field that is visible and also required
# If I am the reporting umpire for a game situation on a Minor League incident form, the following is available
## There is a Category dropdown to select from the categories in the order presented in the table below
### The Category field is required
### If â€œOtherâ€� is selected as a category, there is a text field that is visible and also required
## There is a Reason dropdown to select from the reasons in the order presented in the table below
### These are grouped according to the headers in *bold* in the table
### The Reason field is required
### If â€œOther Reason Not Listedâ€� is chosen from these options, there is a text field that is visible

*Major League Reasons*

||*Reason*||
|Actions during bench-clearing|
|Argued balk call|
|Argued balls and strikes|
|Argued check swing decision|
|Argued decision following crew consultation|
|Argued fair/foul call|
|Argued play on bases|
|Arguing after Replay decision|
|By rule: Mgr ejected because pitcher threw at batter after warning|
|By rule: Warnings issued to both clubs after pitcher immediately ejected|
|Ejected for throwing at batter (no warning in game)|
|Ejected for throwing at batter (warning earlier in game)|
|Fighting|
|Pace of Game Violation|
|Profanity/inappropriate comments to umpire|
|Threw equipment in disgust of call|
|Warned for intentionally throwing at batter|
|Warning issued to prevent retaliation (pitch deemed unintentional)|
|Warnings issued to prevent retaliation (pitch not involved in incident)|
|Other|

*Minor League Categories*

||*Category*||
|Balk/ Illegal Pitch|
|Balls/ Strikes|
|Catch/ No Catch|
|Check Swing|
|Fair/ Foul|
|HBP/ Foul Ball|
|HR/ No HR|
|No Ejection|
|Obstruction/ Interference|
|On-Field Behavior Ejection|
|Safe/ Out|
|Other|

*Minor League Reason*

(Combatant)"}]}]}]},{"type":"tableRow","content":[{"type":"tableCell","attrs":{},"content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Charging The Pitcherâ€™s Mound"}]}]}]},{"type":"tableRow","content":[{"type":"tableCell","attrs":{},"content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Continuing To Further Escalate A Confrontation"}]}]}]},{"type":"tableRow","content":[{"type":"tableCell","attrs":{},"content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Other Reason Not Listed"}]}]}]},{"type":"tableRow","content":[{"type":"tableCell","attrs":{},"content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Equipment Violations","marks":[{"type":"em"},{"type":"strong"}]}]}]},{"type":"tableCell","attrs":{},"content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Throwing Equipment In Disgust Of Call"}]}]}]},{"type":"tableRow","content":[{"type":"tableCell","attrs":{},"content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Heads-Up","marks":[{"type":"em"},{"type":"strong"}]}]}]},{"type":"tableCell","attrs":{},"content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Potential For Future â€œTroubleâ€� Between Clubs"}]}]}]}]}
{adf}

title: Publishing an incident form | Incidents
custom_steps:
As a user with incident publishing permissions, I need a way to publish the incident form when itâ€™s complete

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/kD3Pzzg|https://zpl.io/kD3Pzzg|smart-link]

*AC*

# Given I have the Major or Minor League Incident Publisher permission and Iâ€™m viewing a submitted incident, there is a Publish button available on the form
# The Publish button is disabled until the required fields on the form are filled out. Once the required fields are filled out, the button is enabled
# Clicking publish opens a confirmation modal
## â€œAre you sure you want to publish?â€�
## On Publish
### The form is saved from itâ€™s submitted state to a published state
### The form is closed and the user is navigated back to the incident landing page
### Thereâ€™s a toast message â€œPublishedâ€�

title: Editing a submitted incident form | Incidents
custom_steps:
As a user with incident publisher permissions, I need a way to edit the content of an incident form once itâ€™s been submitted

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/kD3Pzzg|https://zpl.io/kD3Pzzg|smart-link]

# Given I have the Major League or Minor League Incident Publisher permission and I am viewing a submitted incident, there is an Edit Umpire Fields button available on the form

title: Editing a submitted incidents game association | Incidents
custom_steps:
As a user with incident publisher permissions, I need a way to change the game associated with an incident if the wrong game is selected

*Mocks*

Edit Game: [https://zpl.io/jZXZkZQ|https://zpl.io/jZXZkZQ|smart-link]

Admin - Incident: [https://zpl.io/kD3Pzzg|https://zpl.io/kD3Pzzg|smart-link] 

*AC*

# Given I have either the Major or Minor League Incident Publisher Permission and Iâ€™m viewing a submitted incident, there is an Edit Game button available on the incident form
## If I have the Major League Incident Publisher I can only update a Major League Incident
## If I have the Minor League Incident Publisher I can only update a Minor League Incident
# Clicking on Edit Game opens a game selection modal
## The modal contains all games within the same series for the game that was selected for the incident 
## The options on the list show the game date, start time and teams
## One option can be selected from the list
## The Save button is only enabled if a different game is selected
# On Save
## The incident form is updated to reflect the new game selection
## The incident table is updated to reflect the new game selection
## The modal closes and the user is taken back to the incident form
## A toast message is displayed â€œSavedâ€� 
# On Cancel
## The modal closes and the user is taken back to the incident form

title: Umpire - Viewing a returned incident form | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I need to see when an incident has been returned so that I can make updates to the form and re-submit it

*Mocks*

Draft report: [https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|smart-link] 

*AC*

# Given an incident form has been returned and I am the reporting umpire or listed on the crew, there is an entry in the incident landing page table that matches the table record below
# â€œReturnedâ€� is clickable and clicking on it opens the incident form
## The form behaves the same way that it currently does when itâ€™s in a Draft state
## The Delete button is not available on the form 

*Table Entry*

||*Status*||*Game*||*Type*||*People Involved*||*Submitting Umpire*||*Submitted*||
|Returned|[Away @ Home] * [mm/dd/yy] * [game time (local)]|[Aggregate types from the game situation]|[Aggregate people involved from the game situation]|[Last name, first name]|[Submission time]|

*Table Entry*

||*Status*||*Game*||*Type*||*People Involved*||*Submitting Umpire*||*Code*||*Notes*||
|Returned|[Away @ Home] * [mm/dd/yy] * [game time (local)]|[Aggregate types from the game situation]|[Aggregate people involved from the game situation]|[Last name, first name]|[Aggregate the codes from the game situation]| |

title: Umpire - Validating the incident form once submitted | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire with the incident creator permission, I want the incident form to be validated once I submit it so that I know if anything is incorrect on the form

*AC*

# If I am an umpire that has created an incident and is submitting the incident, the form is validated once I click submit
# The validation checks the listed umpires on the report to ensure that no umpire is listed twice on the same game situation
# If an umpire is listed twice, there is an error to alert the umpire that this needs to be corrected before the form can be submitted
## â€œAn umpire cannot be listed more than once on a game situationâ€�

title: Umpire - viewing draft incident reports | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I want need to see incident reports that have been saved as a draft so that I can continue editing them

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/noNGZZr|https://zpl.io/noNGZZr|smart-link]

# Given I am on umpire that either created an incident report or I am listed on the crew of the incident report, there is a draft version of the report available on my incident table that matches the entry below
# Once the report is saved for the first time, it is available to view as a draft
# â€œDraftâ€� is clickable and clicking on it opens the Incident form
# If the Type and People involved extend beyond the length of the cell, there is an ellipses showing that the length of the list extends beyond the cell length
## Hovering on the list shows the full list of Types or People involved

*Table Entry*

||*Status*||*Game*||*Type*||*People Involved*||*Submitting Umpire*||*Submitted*||
|Draft|[Away @ Home] * [mm/dd/yy] * [game time (local)]|[Aggregate types from the game situation]
If no types have been added yet, this is blank|[Aggregate people involved from the game situation]
If no people involved have been added yet, this is blank|[Last name, first name]
This is the reporting umpire from Game Situation 1|[Submission time]
If not submitted, this is blank|

title: Non-umpire viewing incidents that have been submitted | Incidents

title: Non-umpire filtering the incidents page by status | Incidents
custom_steps:
As a user with incidents permissions, I need to filter the incidents page by status

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/O09y57l|https://zpl.io/O09y57l|smart-link]

*AC*

# If I have the Major League Incident Viewer and no other Major League incident permissions and Iâ€™m on the Major League Incidents page
## There is no status filter
## Only Major League incidents are available
# If I have the Major League Incident Publisher permission and Iâ€™m on the Major League Incidents page
## There is a filter for Status that includes the following options and logic
### Submitted 
#### This is the default selection
#### Selecting this shows incidents that are in a Submitted state
### Returned
#### Selecting this shows incidents that are in a Returned state
### Published
#### Selecting this shows incidents that are in a Published state
## This is a multi select list
## Only Major League incidents are available
# If I have the Minor League Incident Viewer permission and no other Minor League incident permission and Iâ€™m on the Minor League Incidents page
## There is no status filter
## Only Minor League incidents are available
# If I have the Minor League Incident Publisher permission and Iâ€™m on the Minor League Incidents page
## There is a filter for Status that includes the following options and logic
### Submitted 
#### This is the default selection
#### Selecting this shows incidents that are in a Submitted state
### Returned
#### Selecting this shows incidents that are in a Returned state
### Published
#### Selecting this shows incidents that are in a Published state
## This is a multi select list
## Only Minor League incidents are available

title: Non-umpire filtering the incidents page by year | Incidents

As a user, I want to filter the incidents page by year so that I can narrow the list of incidents that I want to view

*AC*

# If I have the Major League Incident Viewer permission and Iâ€™m on the Major League Incidents page
## There is a year filter to select which year you want to view
## The year filter includes years between 2022 until the current year and the default is the current year
## Selecting a year filters the incidents available on the table to only those that fall within that year
## Only major league incidents are included in the list
# If I have the Minor League Incident Viewer permission and Iâ€™m on the Minor League Incidents page
## There is a year filter to select which year you want to view
## The year filter includes years between 2022 until the current year and the default is the current year
## Selecting a year filters the incidents available on the table to only those that fall within that year
## Only minor league incidents are included in the list
# If any other filter is selected (covered in additional stories) the filter utilizes AND logic

title: Umpire - Deleting an incident | Incidents

# If I am an umpire with incident creator permissions and an incident is currently in Draft state, there is a Delete button

title: Umpire - Adding a game situation | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire with the incident creator permission, I want to add a game situation to an incident so that I can add multiple situations 

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/9qJz66Y|https://zpl.io/9qJz66Y|smart-link]

*AC*

# If I am an umpire listed on the incident and I have the incident creator permission, I can open the incident when it is in a draft state
# The incident is view only other than the comments section and there is an add situation button

## The Umpires section of the form pre-populates with the umpires from Game Situation 1 and is editable

title: Umpire - Editing a comment | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I want the ability to edit a comment if I need to make any changes

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/vMqmL85|https://zpl.io/vMqmL85|smart-link]

*AC*

# If I am an umpire and have created a comment on an incident, the Edit button is available
# Clicking Edit opens an editable comment box on the comment that is highlighted to show that it is editable
## The original contents from the incident comment are displayed in the box
## A Save and Cancel button are now available
# On Save, any content in the comment box is saved and the editable comment box is changed to display only 
## The comment day/time are updated
## The comments are resorted based on day/time
# On Cancel, any content that has been entered in the box is not saved and the original content is displayed

title: Umpire - Deleting a comment | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I want the ability to delete a comment from an incident form

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/EmvDEGv|https://zpl.io/EmvDEGv|smart-link]

*AC*

# If I am an umpire and have saved a comment on an incident, there is a delete button available
# Clicking the Delete button opens a Delete comment modal that includes the options to Delete, Cancel and also includes the comment
# On Cancel, the comment is not deleted, the modal closes and the comment is still available on the incident
# On Delete, the modal closes and the comment is removed from the incident form
# This functionality is only available for the umpire that created the comment

title: Umpire - Adding a comment | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I want to add a comment to the incident so that I can add additional information

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/xmOMJqJ|https://zpl.io/xmOMJqJ|smart-link]

*AC*

# If I am an umpire, listed as an umpire on the game crew for that incident and the incident is not in a submitted or published state, there is a comment box in the Umpire Comments section
# Once there is text in the comment box, the Save and Cancel buttons are available
# On Cancel, any text is removed from the comment box and the Save and Cancel buttons are hidden
# On Save, any comments that were entered in the comment box are saved to the incident form
## The saved comment includes the following:
### Umpireâ€™s picture
### Last name
### First name
### Day of the week
### Month
### Day
### Year
### Time the comment was submitted
# Once Saved, there is an Edit and Delete button
# Comments are ordered by Date and Time in DESC order

*Notes*

* For the purposes of this story, the Edit and Delete buttons do not need to be functional. This will be covered in additional stories

title: Umpire - Saving the incident form | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire with the incident creator permission, I want the incident form to automatically save so that I donâ€™t have to save anytime I make a change to the form

*Mocks*

Save: [https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|smart-link]

Draft: [https://zpl.io/noNGZZr|https://zpl.io/noNGZZr|smart-link]

*AC*

# Given I have the incident creator permission and an incident is created, the incident form persists automatically
## For all fields that are free text, persist when the field loses focus or the user stops typing after 5 seconds
## For all non text fields, persist immediately on a change
# Underneath the header â€œIncident Reportâ€� there is text that indicates the last time the incident was saved
## Format: â€œSaved mm/dd at [hour::minute]â€�
## Save timestamp is in the userâ€™s local timezone
## While saving, there is a notification in place of the saved timestamp that the form is saving
### â€œSavingâ€¦â€�
# Closing the form leaves the report in a draft state with all the information that has been filled out saved

*Notes*

* The Umpire Comments section does not apply to this story

title: Umpire - Adding the people involved to a game situation | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I need to add the people involved in an incidents so that disciplinary action can be attributed

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|smart-link]

*AC*

# Given I have created an incident and Iâ€™m on the incident form, the people involved section is available
# The section includes a table with the following columns:
## Person(s)
## Type
## Reason
# The Person(s) column includes a dropdown/ search box
## Clicking the dropdown opens a list of all the options that can be chosen and are limited to the teams that have been selected
## The options are broken into sections
### The first section includes the following:
#### Home Team
#### Away Team
#### Both Teams
#### Other
## Then next section includes all the players
### The section is ordered first by home team, away team and alphabetical order by last name
### The players Last and First name are displayed as well as the team
### If a player is selected, there is an additional dropdown to select the position that displays with the following options:
#### Starting Pitcher
#### Relief Pitcher
#### Batter
#### Runner 
#### Position Player
## The last section includes the coaches
### The section is ordered first by home team, away team and alphabetical order by last name
### The coaches Last and First name are displayed as well as the team
### If a coach is selected, there is an additional dropdown to select the coach type that displays with the following options:
#### Manager
#### Coach
#### Support Staff
## Selecting â€œOtherâ€� opens a a free text field titled â€œOther Descriptionâ€� 
## The person(s) field can also be filtered by typing in the Person(s) field box
# There is a Type column that includes a dropdown option
## The dropdown has 4 different types that can be selected when clicking 
### Warning 
### Ejection
### Equipment Violation
### Other
## Select â€œOtherâ€� opens an additional text field 
# There is a Reason column available

*Note*

* Out of scope for this story is the Reason options. This will be covered in another story

title: Umpire - Filling in the general incident information | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I need to be able to add general incident information to the incident form so that I can add more detail about the incident

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|smart-link]

*AC*

# Given I have created an incident, the general section is available
# There is an Incident Description field that includes a long form free text box
## This is a required field
# There is an After Effects field that includes a long form free text box
## This is a required field
# There is a Heads Up option to choose Yes or No
## This is a required field
# There is a Reported by Telephone field to choose Yes or No
## This is a required field
# There is a Crew Chief Verified field with a checkbox
## The checkbox can be selected and deselected
## This is a required field. If it is not checked then the data is saved as a FALSE
## The field includes the following language:
### â€œBy checking this box you certify that the Crew Chief has reviewed and approved this reportâ€�
# The contents of the General section work on both web and mobile devices and match the mocks

title: Umpire - Filling in the game situation | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I need to fill in the game situation on the incident form

*Mocks*

L: [https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|smart-link]

M: [https://zpl.io/o14yvrg|https://zpl.io/o14yvrg|smart-link]

S: [https://zpl.io/o145nEW|https://zpl.io/o145nEW|smart-link]

*AC*

# Given I have created an incident, the game situation is available to fill in
## Game Situation 1 includes the last name of the umpire that created the incident and first initial
# There is a section for the umpires that worked that game
## There are 4 different searchable dropdowns, each dropdown contains the base position matching the order in the mock
## The options for the dropdown are limited to the umpires that are listed on the game crew
## If the umpire positions have been set, then the umpires are automatically assigned those positions on the incident form correlating to that position
## The crew chief or acting crew chief for the game has the indicator and each umpire has their picture if available
# There is a section to fill in the game info
## The inning can be selected from a dropdown and includes the top and bottom of the inning and is capped at 20 innings and includes pre-game, post-game and other
### This is a required field
### If pre-game or post-game are selected, then the Teams, Balls, Strikes and Outs sections are not available and hidden
## Each team has a free text box to input the score. The away team is listed first then the home team and uses the abbreviated name
### These are required fields
## There is an option to select the number of Balls on the count
### This is a required field if any inning option is chosen other than pre-game, post-game and other
## There is an option to select the number of strikes on the count
### This is a required field if any inning option is chosen other than pre-game, post-game and other
## There is an option to select how many outs were recorded
### This is a required field if any inning option is chosen other than pre-game, post-game and other
# There is a section to add the people involved in the situation
## Note: the table and functionality for this piece will be covered in another story
# There is a section to choose the severity
## The following options are available
### Understandable
### Routine
### Too Prolongued
### Offensive
### Very Offensive or Violent
### Other
## Multiple items can be selected
## Selecting â€œOtherâ€� opens a new free text box called â€œSeverity Explanationâ€�
## This is a required field, including the â€œSeverity Explanationâ€� if Other is chosen
# The Delay Time can be added and is a free text box that includes â€œMinutesâ€�
## this is a required field 
# The reporting umpire is displayed an uneditable. This is pulled from the umpire that created the incident report
# The game situation matches the mocks on mobile and web devices

title: Umpire - Incident Form | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I need a form for submitting incidents

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|https://zpl.io/xmOg75g|smart-link]

*AC*

# Given I am an umpire and I have created an incident, the incident form is now available
# The form includes the game info from the game that was selected, including the following: 
## Teams
## Game Date
## Game Time
# The form has the following accordions on the form that can be expanded and collapsed (default to expanded)
## Game Situation 1
## General
## Umpire Comments
# There is a close button and clicking the button closes the form 
## For the purposes of this story, the form does not need to be saved. The close button can just close the form 

*Note*

* The contents of each section will be covered in additional stories
* The save functionality will be covered in another story

title: Umpire - Creating an incident | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I need to be able to create an incident so that I can submit a report after a game

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/5EMGQQo|https://zpl.io/5EMGQQo|smart-link]

*AC*

# Given I am an umpire and I have the Major League Incident Creator permission, the â€œCreate Incidentâ€� button is available on the Incident landing page
# Clicking the button opens the Create an Incident modal
# The modal includes a filter to choose a subset of games:
## Recent Games
### Default
### Includes the 7 most recent days on which the umpire has games assigned
## This Year
### Includes all games from the regular season
# The modal includes all games that the umpire is assigned to based on the schedule
## Games are ordered by most recent game not in a scheduled state
# The game that you want to create an incident for can be clicked. Only one game can be selected
# On Continue, the modal closes and a new incident form pops up
# On Cancel, the modal closes and the user is navigated back to the incident landing page

title: Incident landing page filters | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I want to filter incidents so that I can choose how I want to view the incident page

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/noNGZZr|https://zpl.io/noNGZZr|smart-link]

*AC*

# If I have the Incident Creator permission, there are filters available on the incident landing page
# There are filters for the following:
## Year
## Submitter
## Type
# The Year filter shows all years for which there is an incident that is tied to the umpire
# The Submitter filter has the following options:
## Submitted by Me
### This is the default filter
### This option only shows incidents that were submitted by the umpire
## Submitted by Crew
### This option shows incidents where an umpire is not the submitting umpire, but is listed on the crew in the incident
## All Incidents
### This option shows all incidents either submitted by the umpire or as part of the crew listed on an incident
# The Type filter shows all the different types of incidents and includes the following: 
## All Types 
### This is the default 
## Ejection
## Warning 
## Equipment Violation
## Other
# The filters use AND logic
# The filters can be expanded and collapses on both web and mobile views

title: Umpire Incident landing page | Incidents
custom_steps:
As an umpire, I need an Incident page so that I can create and view incidents

*Mocks*

[https://zpl.io/noNGZZr|https://zpl.io/noNGZZr|smart-link]

*AC*

# Given I am an umpire and I have the incident creator permission, clicking on the Incident tab opens the Incident page
## Note: all umpires should have the incident creator permission
# The page includes a table with the following:
## Status
## Game
## Type
## People Involved
## Submitting Umpire
## Submitted
# All columns of the table can be sorted in either ASC or DESC order
# The page displays on web and mobile and matches the mock
# If I do not have Incident Creator permission, the Incident page is not available

title: SPIKE: Incorporating video into incident reports
